card.name: A Gift for Lords of Men
card.graphics: A Gift for Lords of Men.jpg
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Offering attempt. Playable during CvCC before strikes are assigned, if your Dragon-lord bears an item worth at least 2 mp. The Dragon-lord makes an influence attempt against a non-Hobbit, non-avatar character; modified by the mp value of an item your Dragon-lord bears (+2 if the Dragon-lord is a diplomat). If the result is higher than the target character’s mind, he joins the Dragon-lord’s company; discard all non- follower, non-item cards on the character. Transfer the choosen item to the character. CvCC then procedes normally.

card.name: Aeglin
card.text: Unique. Playable at Cirith Helkaloke. Weapon: +3 prowess (to a maximum of 9 or double bearer’s base prowess). Elf warrior only: tap: take Attuning the Blade from discard pile into hand. Elven Blade may be played on Aeglin.

card.name: Against the Eye
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase at a Shadow-hold [S], if your Dragon-lord is there. Your Dragon-lord faces an attack: Troll – 1 strike at 15 (cannot be canceled). Following the attack tap your Dragon-lord and the site or discard this card. All versions of this site become a Ruins & Lairs [R], this site is never discarded and never untaps for you.

card.name: Alliance among Neighbours
card.text: Playable if your opponent is a Dragon-lord. Place this card in your mp pile. All unique hero factions playable at sites in the region in which the Dragon-lords’ home site or any of his Dragon’s Dens is located, gives an additional miscellaneous mp. Unless the Dragon-lord is in Dragon’s Dream mode, this cards also affects all hero factions in play at sites in regions adjacent to the region of the Dragon-lord’s home site. Each faction so affected can not be affected by any other copy of this card.

card.name: Ando-anca
card.text: Unique. Fire-Dragon. May be played at Norr-dûm. 3 strikes. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Forovirkain, Grey Mountain Narrows, Northern Rhovanion and Withered Heath; may also be played at sites in these regions.

card.name: Ando-anca Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Forovirkain, Grey Mountain Narrows, Northern Rhovanion and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Fire-Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 4 strikes at 14/7. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Dragon Gap, Talath Uichel.

card.name: Ando-anca at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Ando-anca Ahunt is in play, Norr-dûm has an additional automatic-attack: Fire-Dragon — 3 strikes at 17/8. In addition, +1 to all body checks for Dúnedain, Dwarves, Elves, Hobbits, Men,Orcs, Trolls and Umli resulting from unique Dragon attacks.

card.name: Ando-anca Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Ando-anca. Playable at Norr-Dûm if the influence check is greater than 15. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+4) or a greater item (+7); if a manifestation of Scatha is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Ando-anca against any of your companies are canceled. Any company moveing in Forovirkain, Grey Mountain Narrows, Northern Rhovanion, and/or Withered Heath faces an attack: Cold-Dragon — 3 strikes at 16/8 prowess/body.

card.name: Angurth
card.text: Unique. Cold-Dragon. May be played at Long Peak. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. Angurth must always assign strikes to Dwarves first. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountain Narrows, and Withered Heath; may also be played at sites in these regions.

card.name: Angurth Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountain Narrows, and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Cold-Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 3 strikes at 14/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). Angurth must always assign strikes to Dwarves first. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Talath Oiohelka, Talath Uichel.

card.name: Angurth at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Angurth Ahunt is in play, Long Peak has an additional automatic-attack: Cold-Dragon — 2 strikes at 17/8. In addition, each company at a non-Haven [H] site in Wilderland that did not attempt to move has its hazard limit increased by 1.

card.name: Angurth Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Angurth. Playable at Long Peak if the influence check is greater than 13. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+6). All attacks by manifestations of Angurth against any of your companies are canceled. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountain Narrows, and/or Withered Heath faces an attack: Cold-Dragon — 2 strikes at 16/8 prowess/body; (Attacker chooses defending characters). Angurth must always assign strikes to Dwarves first.

card.name: Appetite
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during your organization phase or your site phase. -3 to a roll to bring a character into play or to make him stay in play in your Dragon-lord’s company.

card.name: Are There Dragons in This Land?
card.graphics: Are There Dragons in This Land.jpg
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-character. If bearer is at or moving to a site that is not in a region containing a Dragon’s home site or Dragon’s Den or region adjacent to these, the following applies: tap: untap the Dragon-character or cancel an attack against his company.This card does not normally untap, tap its bearer to untap this card. Discard this card to cancel any effect that would cancel an attack by bearer’s company in CvCC or an influence attempt by the bearer. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon-character.

card.name: Army of Bats
card.text: Flying. Playable at any tapped or untapped Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D] if the influence check is greater than 10. Standard Modifications: none. Once in play, the number required to influence this faction is 0. You receive this faction’s mp if you also have an orc faction in play at the same site. tap during your movement/hazard phase to prevent the play of The Sun Shone Fiercely against a moving company this turn.

card.name: Artful Words
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable on your Dragon-lord. +5 to the Dragon-lord’s EI for the rest of the turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Aryen
card.text: Unique. Agent. +3 EI against animal factions.tap: cancel an Animal, Spider or Wolf attack against his company. Agent only: tap: allow any Animal, Spider and Wolf hazard creature to be played at his Border-hold [B] or Ruins & Lairs [R] site this turn.

card.name: Aura of Fear
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable during CvCC with your Dragon-lord’s company. Make a roll for each character in opponent’s company. If the roll is higher than the character’s mind, he is tapped. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Awakened by his Malice
card.text: Playable if you are Sauron. You may put 1 Balrog or 1 Dragon-character card from your sideboard into your play deck and play him as if he were a character under GI (use 10 mind for a Balrog character)I; The Balrog or Dragon-character cannot ever be a follower of any other of your characters.

card.name: Azog's Scimitar
card.text: Unique. Hoard Item. Weapon. Warrior only: +2 prowess (+4 against Dwarves if held by an Orc leader) to a maximum on 9 (11 against Dwarves). If held by an Orc leader, +2 EI against Orcs, 3 mp and 3 CP.

card.name: Bain
card.text: Unique. +1 prowess against Orcs, Dragons and Drakes. +1 EI against Men with a home site in Northern Rhovanion. +1 EI against Dwarves.

card.name: Bardings
card.text: Men. Each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). May be played keyed to Dorwinion, Grey Mountain Narrows, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, or Southern Rhovanion; and may also be played at non-Haven [H] sites in these regions. May also be played as an additonal automatic-attack at Dale and Lake-town. May not be played against a company containing a non-Dragon-character with a home site located in Dorwinion, Northern Rhovanion, and Southern Rhovanion.

attr.value: men. each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). may be played keyed to dorwinion, grey mountain narrows, iron hills, northern rhovanion, or southern rhovanion; and may also be played at non-haven [h] sites in these regions. may also be played as an additonal automatic-attack at dale and lake-town. may not be played against a company containing a non-dragon-character with a home site located in dorwinion, northern rhovanion, and southern rhovanion.

card.name: Battle of Five Armies
card.text: Unique. Playable if you have at least 1 unique Orc and Wolf faction in play. Make a roll. If the result plus the total mp of your unique Orc and Wolf factions is; less than 9 — you must discard 1 unique Orc or Wolf faction you have in play; 11 or greater — your opponent must discard 1 unique Dwarf, Elf or Man faction he has in play. Remove this card from the game.

card.name: Beaten into Submission
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable if your Dragon-lord´s company is attacked by a non-Dragon-lord manifestation of a Dragon. The attack is canceled. The manifestation becomes an ally under the control of your Dragon-lord (tap your Dragon-lord). The ally has a mind and mp value equal to half (round down) its normal mp value; prowess equal to its normal prowess minus 7 and its normal body. The ally’s skill are warrior, if played on a Fire-dragon; scout, if a Winged-dragon, ranger, if a Cold- or Ice-dragon; sage if a female Dragon; or diplomat if a male Dragon. Place this card with the manifestation. During your organization phase, your opponent makes a roll with +1. If the result is greater than the mind of this ally’s controlling character, the character is immediately attacked by the Dragon manifestation, discard this card and the Dragon manifestation afterwards.

card.name: Belegennon
card.text: Unique. Hoard Item. Armor. +1 body (to a maximum of 9). A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to “restore” it. Once restored, Belegennon gives 4 mp and 3 CP. Warrior only (if restored): If bearer chooses not to tap against a strike, he receives no prowess penalty.

card.name: Birth-spot
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-character. He receives -3 body. When the Dragon-character does not tap to face a strike of an attack, he receives an additional -3 prowess penalty. During his organization phase, a Dragon-character with this card at its home site (or any Dragon’s Den) may tap to discard this card. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Bone-hilted Broadsword
card.text: Hoard Item. Weapon. +2 prowess to a maximum of 8 (+3 to a maximum of 9 against Undead). Warrior only: +1 to body to a maximum of 8.

card.name: Breed Desire
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Your GI is increasedbased on your mp of stored hoard items: 1-6mp +1; 7-12 mp +3; 12-18 mp +5; 19 or more mp +7. Cannot be duplicated on a given player.

attr.value: Information*, Items (minor) *—only if you discard a non-battle gear minor item from the company—
Any man character with a home site in Wilderland may be played (from hand orsideboard), regardless of his alignment, under EI by any character at this site.

Any man character with mind 6 or less and a with home site in Wilderland may be played (from your hand or sideboard), regardless of his alignment, under EI (or GI if you are Sauron) with a company at this site.

card.name: Calm Song
card.text: Magic. Spirit-magic. Song. Playable on a company with a spirit-magic using character facing a non-detainment attack. The attack becomes detainment. Unless he is a Ringwraith, the spirit-magic using character makes a CC modified by -2.

attr.value: during the site phase, discard a Man character from hand to heal (from wounded to untapped) a character at the site. Alternatively, discard Bain Son of Bard, Bard Bowman or Brand from your hand to heal (from wounded to untapped) all characters at the site. For either use tap the site.
Men — each character faces a strike with 7 prowess (detainment against covert company).
during the site phase, discard a Man character from hand to heal (from wounded to untapped) a character at the site. Tap the site if untapped.
A company leaving this site may move as if Angmar and Anduin Vales wereadjacent.
A company leaving this site may move as if Angmar and Anduin Vales wereadjacent.

card.name: Claws Sharpened
card.text: Dragon-character only. Playable during your organisation phase on a Dragon-character. Each strike against the Dragon-character receives -1 prowess and -1 body. Discard Claws Sharpened after a strike against the Dragon-character fails. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon-character.

attr.value: Any non-unique Animal or Wolf ally (normally playable at any site in the Northern Waste, Eriador or Wilder-land) may be played at this site.
Any non-unique animal or wolf ally (normally playable at any site in the Northern Waste, Eriador or Wilder-land) may be played at this site.

card.name: Corlagon
card.text: Unique. May be played at Cirith Helkaloke. Fire-Dragon. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Angmar, Everdalf, Forochel and Gundabad and may also be played at sites in these regions.

card.name: Corlagon Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Angmar, Everdalf, Forochel and/or Gundabad immediately faces a Fire-Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 3 strikes at 10/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Dragon Gap, Talath Uichel.

card.name: Corlagon at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Corlagon Ahunt is in play, Cirith Helkaloke has an additional automatic-attack: Fire-Dragon — 2 strikes at 13/8. In addition, each minor hoard item gives an additional CP.

card.name: Corlagon Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Corlagon. Playable at Cirith Helkaloke if the influence check is greater than 12. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+6); if a manifestation of Scorba is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Corlagon against any of your companies are canceled. Any company moving in Angmar, Everdalf, Forochel, and/or Gundabad faces an attack: Fire-Dragon — 2 strikes at 12/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters).

card.name: Cursed Treasure
card.text: Corruption. Playable on-guard at a Dragon’s Lair, when the appropriate Dragon-character is not there. Place this card on a character, which just played a Treasure item or an item stored (at any version of this site) at the site; the character receives 4 CP and must immediately make a CC.

card.name: Daelomin the Ghost-Wing
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Daelomin. Female. Winged Cold-dragon. May not move. Can use sorcery. Daelomin the Ghost-wing’s prowess is only modified by -1 if not tapping to face a strike. Her flattering rolls are modified by +4. +2 to rolls for bringing male characters into play and for controlling male chracters. tap during CvCC for an extra strike. While at a Dragon's Den, she may tap to cancel one effect that would raise the hazard limit of one of your companies.

attr.value: Dark Enchantment — each non-Wizard character in the company faces a strike with 8 prowess. His prowess against such a strike is equal to his mind

(1st) Dark Enchantment — each character in the company faces a strike with 8 prowess. His prowess against such a strike is equal to his mind stat; (2nd) Dark Enchantment — each character faces a strike with 11 prowess (detainment), but each character that becomes tapped must return to the site of origin.

card.name: Deceived by His Voice
card.text: Flattery Attempt. Playable on a character attempting to influence a faction. Tap the character and make a roll modified by +2 if the character is a diplomat; 1 diplomat only resource or resource that modifies flattery attempts may be played to modifiy this roll. If the result is greater than the listed values, the influence attempt against the faction is automatically successful without tapping the site, otherwise discard the faction. Against a Hobbit, Man, or Animal faction: 10; against a Dwarf, Wose, Orc or Troll faction: 11; against an Elf, Eagle, Dúnadan or Ent faction: 12.

attr.value: Orcs — 3 strikes with 7 prowess (detainment against overt companies)

card.name: Depredation of the Dragon
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase on a Border-hold [B] in a Wilderness [w] if your Dragon-lord is there. Your Dragon- lord’s company faces 2 attacks: attack type as first automatic-attack at the site — 4 strikes with 9 prowess , then — 2 strikes with 12 prowess. Following these attacks, tap your Dragon-lord or discard this card; place this card in your Mmp pile. This site becomes 1 of your Dragon’s Dens and loses all automatic-attacks. All other versions of this site are now Ruins & Lairs [R], and nothing is considered playable as written on the site card. Factions and allies are not playable at the site by your opponent in all cases. If 1 of your companies is at this site, all non-CvCC attacks against it are canceled. Discard this card when the site is discarded or returned to its location deck.

card.name: Destruction and Savagery
card.text: Dragon-character only. Playable during the site phase at a site where you have succesfully played a Thralls faction. Discard all unique factions in play at this site, and no further factions may be played at any version of this site. May not be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Dragon Hunters
card.text: Dwarves. 4 strikes. +4 prowess and -1 to target’s body when facing a Dragon or Drake. May only be played against an overt company. Dragon Hunters receive an additional +1 prowess for every “gathered-bones” of Dwarf characters or Dwarf factions in opponent’s mp pile. May be played keyed to any region containing a Dragon’s lair or Dwarf-hold, and keyed on any non-Haven [H] site in those regions.

card.name: Dragon Mindbend
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a company. This card may be played with a starting company in lieu of a minor item. A character (even a non-Dwarf hero) with a mind up to 8 may be played with target company at a Dragon’s Den; place this card with the character. -2 to his mind to a minimum of 4. When played as such, reveal it when starting companies are determined as if it were a character. No rolls are required for this character to stay in play. Alternatively may also be used to add a hero character that was just influenced away from an opponent’s company by your Dragon-lord to your company. All influence attempts against this character are modified by +4. Cannot be duplicated by a given Dragon-lord.

card.name: Dragon's Abode
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a non-Dragon’s lair Ruins & Lairs [R]; the site must normally be a Ruins & Lairs [R]; in a Wilderness [w], Border-land [b] or Shadow-land [s] if your Dragon-lord is there. The site becomes 1 of your Dragon’s Dens and loses all automatic-attacks. Nothing is considered playable as written on the site card. All other versions of this site gains an additional automatic-attack, which is the same as on your home site. Other Dragon-characters may not use this site as a Dragon’s Den. This site is never discarded or returned to its location deck. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Dragon's Breath
card.text: Playable on an attack by a True Fire-drake, by a Winged Fire-drake, or by any unique manifestation of a Fire-dragon (must be played before strikes are assigned). Each character in the company being attacked must immediately face a strike equal to the attack’s prowess. Instead or using prowess against the strike, each character uses his body modified by +1 if he has a shield, by +1 is he has a helmet, and by +3 if he taps. The target attack which follows receives +1 body and -2 prowess. Cannot be duplicated on a given attack.

attr.value: Place this card on your Dragon's home site. This site is a protected Lord-haven [K]. Non-CvCC attacks against your companies at this site are cancelled. Nothing is considered playable as written on the site card. Your major items are each worth 1 mp, your greater items 2 mp. Items stored at this site always yield full mp. Items stored at this site may be played by an opponent's company (as if in his hand); if any of your companies is present this may only be done after iniciating CvCC. This site always returns to your location deck, along with its associated site.

card.name: Dragon's Dream
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dream mode. Playable during your organization phase on your Dragon-lord at a Dragon’s Den. Return this card to your hand: when you play another dragon mode card. +5 to your GI. Discard if your Dragon-lord moves.

card.name: Dragon's Nest
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your female Dragon-lord if at a Dragon’s Den if you have Mating Duel in play. Your Dragon-lord may not move while bearing this card. Invert this card 90° during each of your following organization phases; once this card is inverted by 360° your Dragon-lord makes a body check and if still in play afterwards, place this card into your mp pile (you now receives its mp). While bearing this card your Dragon-lord receives +2/+1 to prowess and body. Discard any 1 Mating Duel you have in play, once this card is placed in your mp pile.

card.name: Dragon's Ravage
card.text: Unique. Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase if your Dragon-lord just played Burning Rick, Cot and Tree or Smoke on the Wind. You must face the automatic attacks of the site again if an opponent has played a faction at this site. If your Dragon-lord is not wounded you must discard all factions played at this site. The site becomes a Ruins & Lairs [R] with no automatic attacks, nothing is playable there. The site is never discarded and never untaps for you, and is considered as a Haven [K] for purposes of healing only. Rebuid the Town may be played at the site if your Dragon-lord is not present: discard this card.

card.name: Dragon's Sleep
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-character moving away from its home site or any Dragon’s Den. Unless opponent discards Hunger or a Dragon manifestation of the target Dragon- character from his hand; target Dragon- character must return to his site of origin.

card.name: Dragon's Vengeance
card.text: Playable on a company that has faced an attack from a unique Dragon manifestation this turn. You may take Foes Shall Fall or Bring Our Curses Home from your discard pile into hand and play them as if played (normally) on the attack.

card.name: Dragon-flight
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Flying Mode. Playable at a Dragon’s Den during the organisation phase on a Winged Dragon-lord. You may discard this card during the organisation phase if at a Dragon’s Den. Your Dragon-lord receives –2 prowess and may move up to 6 regions and has only his destination site in his site path. At the beginning of the movement-hazard phase, discard all characters and allies without “flying” in your Dragon-lord’s company. At the end of the movement-hazard phase, tap your Dragon-lord if he/she moved this turn.

card.name: Dragon-fright
card.text: Dragon-character only. Playable before assigning strikes when a Dragon-character is facing an attack from a creature or a company. Against a creature, the attack is canceled. Against a company, make a roll for each character in the company. If the result is greater than his mind, the character is tapped.

card.name: Dragon-king
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon-lord if at an Orc-hold if you have a Orc faction in play at this site. This site becomes 1 of your Dragon’s Den (place a Dragon’s-Den copy on it). If at this site, your Dragon-lord may tap to give all your Orc characters +1 prowess and +1 body until the end of the turn. Against opponent’s companies any non-unique Orc creature may be played keyed to the region, which includes this Orc-hold. Discard this card if ever have no Orc faction in play at this Orc-hold. Cannot be duplicated on a given player.

card.name: Dragon-scales
card.text: Playable at a Dragon’s lair, if the associated Dragon has been defeated and you discard a Reforging or Dark-forges from the company. Armor. Helmet. +2 body (to a maximum of 10). Warrior only. +1 prowess. +3 to EI. An additional +2 EI against Dragon or Drake factions. Bearer can play and control a Drake ally. Bearer cannot be targeted by dark or light enchantments. tap: to cancel one attack from a Dragon or Drake hazard creature or automatic-attack. Dragon’s Curse and Dragon-sickness may be played on the bearer, withour further requirements. Cannot be duplicated for a given Dragon)

card.name: Dragonfire and Savage Swords
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable at any tapped or untapped site which is either a hero Haven [H], or an unprotected Lord-haven [H] during the site phase. The company faces 2 attacks (attack type: Dwarves at a Dwarf-hold, Elves at an Elf-hold, Men at all other sites — 5 strikes with 9 prowess, 2 strikes with 12 prowess). If no characters are untapped following the attack, discard this card. Otherwise, tap either your Dragon-lord or 2 other characters in the company and put this card in your mp pile. The site remains a Haven [H] for starter movement purposes only; for all other purposes the site becomes a Free-hold [F] if it was hero Haven [H] or a Ruins & Lairs [R] if it was a Lord-haven [H]. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Durlog
card.text: Unique. Dragon-lord specific. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 8. +3 EI against Orcs.

card.name: Elfhewer
card.text: Unique. Weapon. Playable at Goblin-gate by a leader, if you control the Goblins of Goblin-gate (may also be played at a tapped Goblin-gate if you also control the Great Lord of Gobln-gate). Values in parentheses apply to an Orc bearer. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 9 (+3 against Elves to a maximum of 10 and -1 to strike’s body).

card.name: Enchanted Stare
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. May be played on a character (even a non-dwarf hero) in your starting company, or during the site phase on a character (even a non-dwarf hero) in your Dragon-lord’s company, who was just brought into play by your Dragon-lord. This character requires 3 points of influence to control and may only be controlled by your Dragon-lord’s EI or GI. No rolls are required to keep this character in play. Alternatively may also be played on a hero character that was just influenced away from an opponent’s company by your Dragon-lord. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Enslaved Dwarves
card.text: Unique. Dragon-lord specific. Slave faction. Playable only at a tapped or untapped Dragon’s Den [K] if the influence check is greater than 9. All Dwarf-factions in play at a sites in the same territory as this faction, has its mp value reduced by 1 to a minimum of 1.

card.name: Faster Than the Winds
card.text: Playable during the organization phase on a company with flying ability. The company moves using region movement with no limit on the number of regions that may be in the site path for this company this turn, as long as the regions belong to 2 adjacent territories. Creatures without flying may only be keyed to the company’s destination site. The hazard limit for this company is increased by 1 for every 4 regions the company moves through (Round up fractions). Remove this card from the game.

card.name: Feud with the Dragon
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-lord. You may place this card on an item in your hoard which has a race specific bonus; keep this cardwith the item, you may not play the item from your hoard. Choose a race for which the item gives a bonus: if you control this item, each of opponent’s characters in play of given race has its CC modified by -1 (-2 for minions) and gains +1 prowess against Dragons. CvCC at your Dragon’s Den [K] cannot be canceled. Once the item has come into play again, invert this card: it is worth 3 mp to any player controlling the item.Cannot be duplicated on a given item and for a given race.

card.name: Fire and Water
card.text: Unique. Playable during the site phase at a Border-hold [B] in Northern Rhovanion. A character in the company makes an influence check against a Dragon faction (playable at a site in Northern Rhovanion or its adjacent regions) you already have in play. If successful, remove the faction from the game and place this card in your mp pile. Otherwise discard the faction and remove this card from the game. All versions of the site become Ruins & Lairs [R]. Discard all factions playable at the site – no factions may be played there. Cannot be played by a Fallen-wizard player. Discard this card if Rebuild the Town is played at the site.

card.name: Fire-storm
card.text: Fire-dragon character only. Playable against a creature (or during CvCC) before strikes are assigned. Against a creature make a roll and add the dragon’s prowess. If the result is higher than the creature’s prowess it must make a body check (if it has any, otherwise the creature is automatically defeated). Against a company each opposing character makes a body check modified by –1 for each armor, helmet and/or shield he bears (only 1 item of the same type may be applied). If failed the character becomes wounded. Cannot be duplicated on a given attack or CvCC.

card.name: Fram Wyrmslayer
card.text: Unique. Agent. Manifestation of Fram Framson. +3 prowess against Dragons and Drakes. May not be among the starting characters and may only be brought into play at his home site. Agent only: tap: at a site where an opponent’s Dragon faction is playable to face the associated Dragon attack. +1 to any resulting body checks after the attack. If the attack is defeated, remove the faction from the game.

card.name: Frightful Guardian
card.text: Playable on a site. Until the end of the turn, the company must face all of the site’s automatic attacks each time an item is played at the site (all the attacks receive +1 prowess per item played at the site this turn). Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Gleaming Hoard
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable if you have 10+ mp in hoard items (including 1 point for each minor hoard item). Your hand size is increased by 1. Cannot be duplicated on a given player.

card.name: Great Falcons of Mirkwood
card.text: Unique. Flying. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: none.tap: cancel an attack by a non-unique creature keyed to any region of Mirkwood (by type or name) against any of your moving companies. May also be played as a minion resource by a covert company.

card.name: Great Hoard
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a Dragon’s Den [K]. When an item worth at least 1 mp is stored at this site, place it with this card. You receive this card’s mp when there are at least 3 items placed with this card. Cannot be duplicated at a given site. Discard this card when the site is discarded or returned to its location deck.

card.name: Great Northern Bear
card.text: Animals. Bears. 1 strike. +4 prowess against Dragon-characters. May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Dragon Gap, Grey Mountain Narrows, Gundabad, Heart of Mirkwood, Northern Rhovanion, Western Mirkwood, Withered Heath, and Woodland Realm; and may also be played non-Haven [H] sites in these regions. May not be played against a company containing any character with Beorn’s House as his home site. Cannot be duplicated on a given movement/hazard phase.

card.name: Great Ruin and Fire under Tree
card.graphics: Great Ruin and Fire under Tree.jpg
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase on your Dragon-lord’s company at any non-Dragon’s Den, non-Ruins & Lairs [R] in a Wilderness [w]. The company faces 3 attacks (no type) — 4 strikes with 9 prowess, 3 strikes with 11 prowess, 2 strikes with 13 prowess. Following the attacks, tap your Dragon-lord or discard this card. If not discarded, discard any factions in play at this site. Your opponents may not play any character or resource at this site. All versions of this site become a Ruins & Lairs [R]. Discard this card when the site is discarded or returned to its location deck. Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Greater Storms
card.text: Playable on a flying company. Make a roll. If the result is less than 7, tap all characters and allies in the company. Otherwise, the company is not considered flying for the rest of the turn.

card.name: Grim Voiced and Grim Faced
card.text: Unique. Playable on Bard Bowman. +2 to his mind, prowess and body. Except when facing an attack or strike, Bard may tap to untap a Black Arrow he is bearing. This card may be played in a starting company in lieu of a minor item.

card.name: Grim-faced Northman
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. If at any of his home sites, tap Grim-faced Northman during your site phase to search your play deck or discard pile for any 1 character, ally, faction or that is playable at his current site (reshuffle play deck if searched) and place it in your hand.

attr.value: Any site in Northern or Southern Rhovanion

card.name: Grimbeorn the Old
card.text: Unique. +2 prowess against Orcs. +2 EI against the Beornings faction. Counts as Beorn for the purpose of playing Skin-changer. Discard Grimbeorn if his controlling player has Bad Company in play.

card.name: Grimson the Fearless
card.text: Unique. If you are a Dragon-lord, Grimson the Fearless may play allies normally playable by Dragon-characters only. He may control a maximum of 2 such allies.

attr.value: this site is considered a Haven [H] for the purposes of healing.
Men — each character faces a strike with 6 prowess (detainment against covert company).
this site is considered a Haven [K] for the purposes of healing.

card.name: Heart of the Great Wyrm
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. You may play a character at his home site during the site phase even if your Dragon-lord is not there. If the roll required to bring him into play is less than the character’s mind plus 1, discard the character.

card.name: Hide pitted with Corruption
card.text: Dragon-character only. +3 body for the rest of the turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Hollow on the Left Breast
card.text: Information. Stolen Knowledge. Ranger or scout only. Playable on a Dwarf, Elf, Hobbit or Man during the site phase at any Dragon’s Lair or Border-hold [B] in Northern Rhovanion. Tap the character and the site. When facing a Dragon-character in CvCC its body is halved (round up). Discard this card if any Dark-enchantment is played on the character or after a Dragon-character has been defeated by the company in CvCC. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Honey
card.text: Unique. Dragon-lord specific. Treasure. Playable only by your Dragon-lord at an untapped Beorn’s House (or at any site where Hives is in play).

card.name: Horn of Defiance
card.text: Unique. Hoard Item. +2 EI. A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to “restore” it. Once restored, Horn of Defiance gives 3 mp and 2 CP. If bearer is the first to face a strike of an attack, that character may choose to face all strikes of the attack. The character faces a separate strike sequence for each strike.

card.name: Hunger
card.text: Dragon-character only. Dragon-character must move every turn from a site in a Wilderness [w] (or from his home site), to a non-Free-hold [F] or non-Dark-hold [D] through at least 2 Wilderness [Ww] till he/she has eliminated a creature, character, ally or faction. The Dragon-character cannot move farther than 4 regions resp. 6 regions away from any of his Dragon’s Dens [K], afterwards he/she has to return to any of its Dragon’s Dens [K]. Discard this card if the Dragon-character returns to any of its Dragon’s Dens [K] after he/she has eliminated a creature, character, ally or faction. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon-character.

card.name: Hunters and Slayers
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on one of your companies during CvCC before rolls are made. For each successful strike, the defeated character is not wounded, but rather placed ´´off to the side´´ with this card. Discard if no characters are placed with this card. Make a roll during your end-of-turn phase. If the result is less than 7, discard this card. If the company size is ever lower than the number of characters placed with this card, discard this card. If this card is discarded, the surviving characters immediately form a company at the company’s current site or new site. When stored at your Dragon’s Den, eliminate all cards placed with this card. You gain kill mmp for every character eliminated in this way.

card.name: Hunting
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Hunting Mode. Playable during your organization phase on your Dragon-lord at a Dragon’s Den [K]. You may discard this card during the organisation phase if at a Dragon’s Den. Your Dragon-lord receives – 2 prowess, may not control characters and may move using region movement to sites in same or adjacent region to your current Dragon’s Den. For any company moving in same region as your Dragon-lord, you may choose to have it face an attack of your Dragon-lord. His prowess is increased by 7, and any body checks resulting by a succesfull strike of this attack are +1. Attacker chooses defending characters if your Dragon-lord is winged. If the strike fails, your Dragon-lord is wounded (make no body check).

card.name: Itangast the Guest-eater
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Itangast. Male. Fire-dragon. May not move. Itangast the Guest-eater’s prowess is only modified by -1 if not tapping to face a strike. His offering rolls are modified by +4. tap during CvCC for an extra strike. -3 influence against any manifestation of Smaug or Scatha. +2 prowess against Men and Dwarves. While at Gold Hill, your Orcs and Trolls require 1 less influence to control.

card.name: Khuzadrepa
card.text: Unique. Cold-Dragon. May be played at Thunder Cleft. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be keyed to Grey Moutain Narrows, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, and Withered Heath and to sites in these regions. +2 prowess against Dwarves.

card.name: Khuzadrepa Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Grey Mountain Narrows, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Cold-Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 3 strikes at 13/8 (attacker chooses defending characters); +2 prowess against Dwarves. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Dorwinion, Forrhun.

card.name: Khuzadrepa at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Khuzadrepa Ahunt is in play, Thunder Cleft has an additional automatic-attack: Cold-Dragon — 2 strikes at 16/9. In addition, each Dwarf wounded by a strike from a Balrog, Dragon or Spawn must make a CC modified by -1, after the body roll was made.

card.name: Khuzadrepa Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Khuzadrepa. Playable at Thunder Cleft if the influence check is greater than 14. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+6); if a manifestation of Agburanar is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Khuzadrepa against any of your companies are canceled. Any company moving in Grey Mountain Narrows, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, and/or Withered Heath faces an attack: Cold-Dragon — 2 strikes at 15/9 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters); +2 prowess against Dwarves.

card.name: Kine of Araw
card.text: Animals. Each character in the company faces a strike. May be played keyed to Dorwinion, Forrhûn, Harrhûn, Horse Plains and Southern Rhovanion; and also at Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions. +2 prowess if the company has already faced Kine of Araw this turn. A character whose home site is in any of the above regions may tap to cancel an attack by Kine of Araw against his company.

card.name: King of Dale
card.text: Unique. Playable on Bard Bowman, Bain or Brand, if you have at least 3 unique hero factions in play at sites in Northern Rhovanion or its adjacent regions and you have defeated a unique Dragon manifestation with a home site in one of these regions. +2 to bearer’s EI. Factions playable at sites in these regions are worth +1 mp to you. Automatic- attacks at any site in Northern Rhovanion attack normally, not as detainment, and with +2 prowess against minion companies.

card.name: Knowledge of Their Making
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Lore. Playable by your Dragon-lord at Isengard or any site with a Nazgûl automatic-attack. Tap your Dragon-lord and the site. +2 to all ring test rolls in any of your companies. If your Dragon-lord’s company successfully plays an item, it may tap a character to play any item with him, which is playable at the companies site, instead of a free minor item. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon-lord.

card.name: Leucaruth the Wrathful
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Leucaruth. Female. Fire-dragon. +2 prowess against Dwarves. Unless Leucaruth the Wrathful is in a mode she may move one region. If an opponent’s company including Dwarves is within 2 regions of her home site, she may move 2 regions to opponent’s site. After such a movement Leucaruth the Wrathful must always return to her home site on the next turn. Leucaruth the Wrathful’s prowess is only modified by -1 if not tapping to face a strike. -2 to the body of any Dwarf wounded by 1 of her strikes. -2 to rolls for bringing Dwarves into play and controlling Dwarves.

card.name: Life-negotiations
card.text: Offering attempt. Playable on a character whose company is facing a non-detainment attack of the type listed below. Character makes an influence check (modified by his unused EI and +2 if a diplomat, +1 for each non-unique animal ally (or character taken prisoner) that is eliminated from the company). If successful, the attack is cancelled and the hazard limit for the character’s company is decreased by 2. This influence check is successful if the result is greater than: 9 against a Dragon; 10 against Drakes, Giant, Orcs, or Trolls, 11 against Animals, Spawn, Undead or Wolves.

card.name: Lomaw
card.text: Unique. Ice-Dragon. May be played at Collarmount. 3 strikes. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be keyed to Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Talath Oiohelka and Talath Uichel and to sites in these regions (attacker chooses defending characters if keyed to the these regions).

card.name: Lomaw Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Talath Oiohelka and/or Talath Uichel immediately faces an Ice-Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 4 strikes at 12/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Iron Hills, Withered Heath.

card.name: Lomaw at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Lomaw Ahunt is in play, Collarmount has an additional automatic- attack: Ice-Dragon — 3 strikes at 15/8. In addition, all creatures with Ice or Cold in their title have their prowess and body modified by +1; and all of these creatures with no body have 4 body.

card.name: Lomaw Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Lomaw. Playable at Collarmount if the influence check is greater than 13. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+5), if a manifestation of Agburanar, Gostir, or Itangast is in play (-4), +1 for every animal or wolf faction you have in play in the Northern Waste. All attacks by manifestations of Lomaw against any of your companies are canceled. Any company moving in Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Talach Oiohelka, and/or Talach Uichel faces an attack: Ice-Dragon — 3 strikes at 14/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters).

card.name: Lomaw the Old
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Lomaw. Male. Ice-dragon. May not move. Lomaw the Old’s prowess is only modified by -1 if not tapping to face a strike. His riddling and offering rolls are modified by +2. tap during CvCC for an extra strike. -3 influence against any manifestation Agburanar, Gostir, or Itangast. If an opponent’s company is moving through the region of your current site, you may look at a number of cards equally to the Wilderness [w] regions it their site path.

attr.value: Items (minor major, greater*) *—battle gear items only—
Items (minor major, greater*) *—battle gear items only—

card.name: Lulled by His Words
card.text: Flattery Attempt. Playable during the site phase on a character attempting to influence away an opponent’s non-avatar character (as listed below). Make a roll modified by +2 if the character is a diplomat. If the result is greater than the listed values, the character is automatically influenced away. Against Men, Orcs, or Trolls 8; against Dwarves and Hobbits 9; against Dúnedain and Elves 10.

card.name: Make Use of His Desire
card.text: Offering attempt. Playable during opponent’s site phase on a diplomat when CvCC i ap is declared. Target diplomat makes a CC. If he does not fail, discard an item from his company (as listed below) and make a roll adding his unused EI. If the result is greater than the listed values, the attack is canceled and you may take one resource from your play deck (reshuffle) or discard pile into hand. Greater item/5, major item/6, gold ring item/7, minor item/8.

card.name: Marauding Fire
card.text: Playable on a Fire-dragon-character when facing an attack. The Dragon-character receives +4 prowess, -2 to attack’s body. Cannot be duplicated on a given attack.

attr.value: Men — 2 strikes with 6 prowess (detainment against covert companies)
Port on Anduin. agents attack with +2 prowess at this site.

card.name: Mating Duel
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on an untapped Dragon-lord as his company faces an attack by an unique Dragon manifastation. If your Dragon-lord and the manifastation are of the opposite-sex, tap your Dragon-lord to cancel the attack. If you face an attack by any manifastation of this unique Dragon you may rotate Mating Duel by 90° to cancel this attck against your Dragon-lord’s company or to convert the attack to detainment against any other of your companies. Discards Mating Duel when it is inverted by 360°.

card.name: Memories of Ancalagon
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Wound your Dragon-lord to cancel a Dragon or Drake attack against 1 of your companies. Alternatively, play to heal your Dragon-lord (from wounded to tapped).

card.name: Men of the Wood
card.text: Men. Each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Heart of Mirkwood and Western Mirkwood; and may also be played at non-Haven [H] sites in these regions. May also be played as an additional automatic-attack at Woodmen-town or any other Border-hold [B] in these regions. May not be played against a company containing a character with Woodmen-town as a home site.

attr.value: men. each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). may be played keyed to anduin vales, heart of mirkwood and western mirkwood; and may also be played at non-haven [h] sites in these regions. may also be played as an additional automatic-attack at woodmen-town or any other border-hold [b] in these regions. may not be played against a company containing a character with woodmen-town as a home site.
No Better Use may be stored at this site instead of at Shelob's Lair.
Rescue Prisoners may be played at this site.

card.name: No Match in Your Treasuries
card.text: Playable on a unique stored item. This item gives no mp. All opponents’ total item mp are reduced by the amount of mp this item would normally give.

card.name: No Weapon seemed to bite him
card.graphics: No Weapon seemed to bite him.jpg
card.text: Dragon-character only. Playable when facing, a dunadan, dwarf, elf, man or orc attack, or during CvCC. The Dragon-character receives +1 prowess/ +2 body. Weapons do not modify the prowess of any character assigning its strike(s) to the Dragon-character. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Oath to the Dragon
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a character in your Dragon-lord’s company (or in your starting company). The character: becomes a leader (if not already), receives +1 to CC and cannot be discarded by a body check. Additionally the character can only be controlled by your Dragon-lord or your GI and no rolls are required to keep the character in play. All influence attempts against this character are modified by -3. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Of the Race of Dale
card.text: Playable on Bard Bowman, Bain or Brand. When bearinga Black Arrow and assigned a strike from a Dragon orDrake attack, tap Black Arrow to give a -3 modification to prowess and body (instead of its normal modification). Discard this card if there is more than 1 Black Arrow in the company.

card.name: Old and Cunning
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Tap your Dragon-lord to take 1 resource from your sideboard straight into your hand; your Dragon-lord may not untap until the end of your next turn.

card.name: Old Winyards
card.text: Playable at any tapped or untapped Border-hold [B]. Discard Old Winyards during the site phase at any Free-hold [F] to make 1 minor item playable at the site (even if the site is tapped) You may play a major item instead if you discard 2 copies of Old Winyards, or a greater item if you discard 3.

card.name: Orc of the Claw
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Discard on a body check result of 7. -3 on influence attempts against factions.

card.name: Orcs of the Claw
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable at your Dragon’s Den by your Dragon-lord if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: Each orc faction in play in the same region as your Dragon’s Den(–2) Special: The Orcs of the Claw factions is worth 1 mp plus 1 mp for any other Orc faction you have in play at a site in the same region to a maximum of 4 mp. Cannot be duplicated on a given player.

card.name: Outfitted from the Hoard
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon’s Den [K].tap: during the site phase to make 1 non- unique major or greater hoard item playable by a non-Dragon-lord character at this site (even if tapped, this does not tap the site). Place this card with the item, the item gives -1 item mp. This item may never be stored.

card.name: Pierced with Enchantment
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable on your Dragon-lord. Tap during CvCC and target a non-avatar character facing a strike from your Dragon-lord (the strike is cancelled). The character loses all skills and game text and may not tap to play resources until the end of your next turn. Keep this card with the character. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.”

card.name: Resistance of Will
card.text: Playable during your opponent’s site phase, if your opponent makes an influence attempt against 1 of your characters, or if opponent’s Dragon-lord attempts to bring a character into play. Based on that character’s normal mind, you may modify opponent’s roll by the following: 1-4 mind: -2; 5-7 mind: -3; 8+ mind: -4.

card.name: Riches Gathered
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-lord. At the end of opponent’s organisation phase, make a roll for every character controlled by that player bearing an item at same site as Dragon-lord. If result > 8, that character faces an attack from the Dragon-lord (ignore result if attack fails).

card.name: Ringil
card.text: Unique. Hoard Item. Weapon. +1 body. Warrior only: +1 prowess (to a maximum of 8). A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to “restore” it. Once restored, Ringil gives 4 mp, 3 CP and +5 prowess (to a maximum of 11).

card.name: Rivermen of the Anduin Vales
card.text: Unique. Playable at Mathlaburg if the influence check is greater than 7Standard Modifications: character with home site in Anduin Vales or Western Mirkwood (+2). Tap to reveal the top 5 cards of your play deck and take 1 ring item into hand (reshuffle)

card.name: Roaming
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-character at its home site or at a Dragon’s Den [K]. You may discard this card during the organisation phase if at a Dragon’s Den [K]. The Dragon-character receives –2 prowess and may move using region-movement (limited to 2 regions).

card.name: Rumour of Treasure
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Your Dragon-lord may move to any Free-hold [F] or Dark-hold [D] not in a Wilderness [w] using region movement with a region maximum of 4 regions, 6 regions resp. if a winged Dragon-lord. Your Dragon-lord must stay at this site or move to any of his Dragon’s Den [K] once the Free-hold [F] or Dark-hold [D] is tapped. Discard this card if your Dragon-lord successfully moves to a Dragon’s Den from the Free-hold [F] or Dark-hold [D].

card.name: Scales and Jewels
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon-lord if he/she bears a Treasure or Jewel item worth at least 2 mp. Remove the item from the game. Your Dragon-lord receives +2 body (to a maximum of 11).

card.name: Scatha the Worm
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Scatha. Male. Cold-dragon. May not move. +2 prowess against Elves and Dwarves. Scatha the Worm’s prowess is only modified by -1 if not tapping to face a strike. While at Gondmaeglom, he gives +1 to all your influence attempts. If at Gondmaeglom, Scatha the Worm may tap to bring any 1 resource short-event that can be played on a Dragon character from your discard pile into your play deck. tap during CvCC for an extra strike.-3 influence against any manifestation of Itangast or Smaug.

card.name: Share of the Treasure
card.text: Hoard item. Treasure. Discard to cancel a detainment attack by Orcs, Dwarves, Dúnedain or Men against the bearer’s company. The limit of how many Share of the Treasures you can include in your deck is 14.

card.name: Shoot in the Eye
card.text: Information. Warrior only. Playable only by a Dwarf, Orc, or Man during site phase at the Wind-throne or at any Dragon’s Lair. Tap the site and the character. When facing a dragon-character in CvCC its body is halved (round up). This does not apply against Dragon creature attacks. Discard if this card if Memories Stolen is played on the character. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Sign of Might
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon-lord if he/she bears The One Ring. Make a roll adding 1 for each sage in his company and each Sign of Might in play. If the result is: less than 8, your Dragon-lord is eliminated; 8 or 9, discard this card; 10, 11 or 12, you gain 2 mp and The One Ring affects your Dragon-lord; greater than 12, you win the game. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Smaug the Golden
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Smaug. Male. Winged Fire-dragon. May not move. Smaug the Golden’s prowess is only modified by -1 if not tapping to face a strike. His riddling rolls are modified by +4. -3 influence against any manifestation of Ando-anca, Itangast or Scatha.

card.name: Spell-bound
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable on your Dragon-lord. Each opponent’s company moving with region movement through the region containing your Dragon-lord’s current site must make a roll modified by +2 for each sage, and by +1 for each scout, and by +1 for each diplomat, and by -2 if your Dragon-lord is in Dream Mode. If the result is 10 or less, your opponent must replace the company’s new site with his version of your Dragon-lord’s current site. The company may do nothing during the site phase. Discard if an opponent’s company had to move to your Dragon-lord’s current site, based on this card’s ability. Cannot be duplicated on given Dragon-lord.

card.name: Spoilation
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase if your Dragon-lord is at a non-Ruins & Lairs [R] site. If your Dragon-lord successfully plays an item this turn, he is not tapped and may face all of the site’s automatic-attacks again to play another item. He may do this as often as he likes, but receives -3 to his prowess for every additional automatic-attack faced after the normal ones. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Stalk the Halls
card.text: Cavern Mode. Playable on your Dragon-lord. Discard any other mode cards you have in play when you play this card. Your Dragon-lord may move using Under-deeps movement. +1 to rolls required to move between adjacent Under-deeps sites. Your Dragon-lord suffers the full -3 to prowess for not tapping to face a strike. In addition, the Dragon-lord suffers a -2 to prowess if his current site’s surface site is not a Dragon’s Den [K].

attr.value: Undead. Dragon — 1 strike with 16 prowess —neither attack nor strike can be canceled—

When this site is revealed opponent may search his discard pile for a card which must be placed on-guard. If this card is not revealed it returns to the discard pile after the site phase. Any item worth more than 3 mp playable at non-specific sites may also be played at this site.
Undead. Dragon — 1 strike with 16 prowess —neither attack nor strike can be canceled—

When this site is revealed opponent may search his discard pile for a card which must be placed on-guard. If this card is not revealed it returns to the discard pile after the site phase. Any item worth more than 3 mp playable at non-specific sites may also be played at this site.

card.name: Talmog
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 8. +3 EI against Orcs.

card.name: Targeted for the Hunt
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the organization phase on your Dragon-lord (if not at a Dragon’s Den [K]). Name a creature that can be keyed to the site or the site’s region (ignore multiple regions). If the hazard player has that creature in hand, it immediately attacks; otherwise he must show his hand.

card.name: Territorial Disputes
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the organization phase if any unique Dragon (other than yourself) is in play. Take the Dragon’s Lair for that manifestation from your location deck and place it off to the side with this card. Your Dragon-lord may move to this site using region movement (no maximum). If your Dragon-lord is at this site, he faces a non-automatic attack at the beginning of the site phase that is a duplicate of the first automatic attack with +1 strike and +3 prowess. Immediately after this attack, tap your Dragon-lord or discard this card.During the site phase at this site, your Dragon-lord may make a roll and play an item (from your hand or discard pile) based on the result: 2-3: minor item; 2-6: gold ring item; 7-9: major item; 10-12: greater item; (Any Result) stored item. When your Dragon-lord plays an item at this site, you receive the card’s mp and it is placed in your mp pile; the site is no longer off to the side or associated with this card.

card.name: The Dragon's Disciple
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. +2 EI against Men.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: The Master
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against any faction playable at Lake-town. -1 to all of his CC.tap: during any player’s turn, to cancel an attempt by a Dragon-character to bring a character into play at Lake-town or Dale.

attr.value: Contains a hoard. Any company at this site has its hazard limit increased by 1 for every unique Dragon manifestation in play.
Contains a hoard. Any company at this site has its hazard limit increased by 1 for every unique Dragon manifestation in play.

card.name: Thralls
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Slave Faction. Playable only at a tapped or untapped non-Dragon’s Den [K] site in same region as your Dragon’s Den if the influence check is higher than 8. Tap the Thralls faction during the end-of-turn phase to allow characters (at this site) to store items as though it were their organization phase at a Dragon’s Den [K] (these items are stored at your nearest Dragon’s Den [K]. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Throkmaw
card.text: Unique. Fire-dragon. May be played at Shab Arch. 3 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Talath Oiohelka, Talath Uichel and Withered Heath and to sites in these regions.

card.name: Throkmaw Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Talath Oiohelka, Talath Uichel and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Fire-Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 4 strikes at 13/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Barl Syrnac, Grey Mountains Narrows.

card.name: Throkmaw at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Throkmaw Ahunt is in play, Shab Arch has an additional automatic- attack: Fire-Dragon — 2 strikes at 16/8. In addition, each Orc hazard creature played keyed to a region or at a site in the Northern Waste receives +1 prowess and strikes.

card.name: Throkmaw Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Throkmaw. Playable at Shab Arch if the influence check is greater than 14. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+2) or a greater item (+7); if a manifestation of Smaug or Itangast is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Throkmaw against any of your companies are canceled. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Talath Oiohelka, Talath Uichel, and/or Withered Heath faces an attack: Fire-Dragon — 3 strikes at 15/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters).

card.name: Throkmaw the Vain
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Throkmaw. Male. Winged Fire-dragon. May not move. Throkmaw the Vain’s prowess is only modified by -1 if not tapping to face a strike. tap during CvCC for an extra strike. If at a Dragon’s Den he may tap to give +1 prowess and +1 body to all Orcs in any of your companies until the end of the turn. When tapping to face a strike +1 to all body checks resulting from failed strikes against Throkmaw the Vain. -3 influence against any manifestation of Ando-anca Itangast, Scatha or Smaug.

attr.value: Dragon — 1 strike with 13 prowess (attacker chooses defending character)
Vein of Arda may be played on a Dwarf at this site, as if at an Under-deeps site.
Dragon — 1 strike with 13 prowess (attacker chooses defending character)
Durang may be played on a Dwarf or Orc at this site, as if at an Under-deeps site.

card.name: Too Narrow a Hole
card.text: -3 do a dragon-characters under-deep movement rolls if moving to an under-deep site (but not away to a surface site

card.name: Treason
card.text: Dragon-character only. Dragon-magic. Dark-Enchantment. Playable during CvCC before strikes are asigned. Choose a non-avatar, non-ringwraith, non-undead, non-maia character. Make a roll. If the result is greater than the character’s mind +2, the character is treated, as if being in the Dragon-character’s company during this attack. The character does not leave his company. May not be duplicated on a given attack.

card.name: Treason the Chiefs
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on Border-hold [B] where an opponent has unique Man faction in play, if your diplomat Dragon-lord is there.Your Dragon-lord may attempt to influence the faction as if it were in your hand. If successful, put the faction in your kill mp pile. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Ulred
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against Rivermen of the Anduin Vales faction.

card.name: Under his Spell
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Dark Enchantment. Playable on your Dragon-lord. Tap this card during CvCC and target a non-avatar character facing a strike from your Dragon-lord (the strike is cancelled); place this card with the character. The character cannot untap and receives -2 to all CC while bearing this card. Treat this card as a hazard permanent-event once it is placed on an opponent’s character. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Unquenchable Flames
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase on your Dragon-lord’s current site if a faction controlled by an opponent is in play there. Your Dragon-lord’s company faces an attack (same type as faction - 3 strikes at 10). After this attack, tap a character or discard this card. If not discarded, all versions of the site become Ruins & Lairs [R]. This site is never discarded or returned to the location deck. Discard all factions in play at this site; no factions may be played here by other players. Cannot be duplicated at a given site. Discard Unquenchable Flames if an opponent reveals for no effect Rebuild the Town or Hold Rebuilt and Repaired during the site phase at this site.

card.name: Unsatiable Hunger
card.text: (no good name yet) - -event Playable only if your opponent is a Dragon. This card may be played during your opponent’s organization phase. Did I loose these versions or where these two cards never finished???

card.name: Uruial
card.text: Unique. Dragon. Undead. Playable at SteelFall. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may be keyed at any Dragon’s lair if the associated Dragon was eliminated or is in play but not at the site. Any character wounded by a strike of this creature must make a CC modified by -2.

card.name: Veil Removed
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable only during the movement/hazard phase of your Dragon-lord’s company. Discard 1 hazard permanent-event in play on your company.

card.name: Wealth of his Halls
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a Dragon’s Den [K]. tap: make 1 non-unique minor or major item playable here (does not tap the site and may be played at a tapped site). The item may also be taken from any items stored at this site. Cannot be duplicated at a given site. Discard this card when the site is discarded or returned to its location deck.

card.name: Weary and Asleep
card.text: Playable on a moving hero company. Place 1 counter on this card if the company moves to a non-Haven [H] site; delete 1 counter from it if the company moves to a Haven [H] or Shadow-hold [S]; delete 2 counters if the company moves Dark-hold [D]; delete an additional counter if the company moves to an Under-deep site.At the end of each movement/hazard phase, tap 1 character for ech counter on this card. For each food item in the company (to a maximum of 3) you may ignore the effect of 1 counter. Discard this card if there are no counters on it.

card.name: Western Winds
card.text: Any minion or Dragon-character company moving to a Free-hold [F] site in the following regions must immediately return to its site of origin: Lindon, any Region of Eriador, Anfalas, Belfalas, Lamedon, Lebennin, Anórien, Anduin Vales, Wold & Foothills, Fangorn, Gap of Isen, or Rohan.

card.name: Whispers of Wealth
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Greed mode. Playable during your organization phase on your Dragon-lord at a Dragon’s Den [K]. Return this card to your hand: when you play another Dragon-mode card. When a company plays an item at a site within 4 regions away from your current Dragon’s Den, resp. 6 regions for a Winged Dragon-lord, discard this card to relocate your Dragon-lord to that site. Your Dragon-lord engages CvCC, and 1 strike MUST target the character that has played the highest mp value item this turn.

card.name: Wide Awake
card.text: Dragonlord specific. Untap your Dragon-lord. Alternatively a CvCC with your Dragon-lord at a Dragon’s Den cannot be canceled by an opponent. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Wielder of old Arts
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon-lord. Tap your Dragon-lord during your end-of-turn phase to take 1 Dragon-magic card from discard pile into your hand. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon-lord.

card.name: Wyrm's Blood
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-character. Untap the Dragon-character. May also be played when a Dragon-character fails a body check. The character or creature having wounded the Dragon-character must make a body check and is killed if it fails.

card.name: Wyrm's Reek
card.text: Cold-Dragon only. Playable before declaring CvCC. You may play an animal, wolf or spider creature keyable on the site or the site’s region on opponent’s company before resolving CvCC.
